DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Investigational New Drug Regulation Process Begin Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date the regulator process for the Investigational New Drug (IND) began.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Protocol Investigational New Drug Regulation Process
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the regulatory process of an experimental drug used on a clinical trial following FDA approval of an application for testing the drug in people.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered.:Status given an experimental drug after the FDA approves an application for testing it in people. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
A new drug or biological drug that is used in a clinical investigation. The term also includes a biological product that is used in vitro for diagnostic purposes.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of controlling the rate or manner in which a process progresses or a product is formed.:A sequence of events which produces some outcome.

Concepts.definition: A process that acts to control the rate or manner in which another process progresses or a product is formed.
A sequence of events which produces some outcome.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation or an event began.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/23/17 jk transferred context, cap first letter in def, and added CSI, registration status per Round 5 finalization task.
